title: The heck is Akali
body:
A summary of her abilities:

* Passive - I can heal and deal extra damage every few seconds.
* Q - I'm just going to throw this at you every 2 seconds and if I hit you then _sayonara_.
* W - I'm tired, going to take a nap for 8 seconds **or** I'm going to use this to get over a wall **or** just going to reposition myself and land a free Q+auto.
* E - Hey, I'm just going to do this spin move that deals damage all around me and I can basically spam this.
* R - Trying to run? NOPE. Oh you flashed? TOO BAD. Oh you used a dash? SORRY. You can't run from me when I have this up.

Honestly, why should an assassin that can turn invisible for 8 seconds have such an easy kit to deal damage? Just Q R _auto_ E and delete everyone and there is no chance they can dodge this because Q is a click on, R is also a click on, E deals damage around her so after she Rs, she's right on top of you. Maybe they flash after she Rs? Good luck, she has another one. You used a dash ability? She has another one. You have another dash ability? Nope, still one more.

It's pretty annoying when you are Zed and have used all of your shadows **and** your flash and she can STILL get right up in your face. Akali got Hextech Gunblade and healed all the poke I did with my full combo in one wave. A literal joke this champion. I know this is going to get down-voted but this is my honest opinion. League is a "smash or get smashed" game and rarely if not ever are you going to have a balanced game where the deciding outcome is skill.

I can already tell those Akali mains are going to argue in the comments on how Akali is difficult to play or how bad I am but to be honest? I'd like to hear that. I actually want to know how this champion is balanced because I cannot think of a single reason. Assassins are supposed to go in, kill someone, back off, recharge, then re-engage and strike again but you have Akali who can literally nap in the middle of the fight after killing someone and for what. After she goes in and kills someone, she just presses W and waits for her team to cover  for her. What can the enemy do but try and guess where she is or retreat? If they stay, it's a 4 v 5 and Akali's spells are all on low CDs and so by the time the team is there, she's up and ready to go again.

Akali is a burst-type champion and so I know that after she has used her spell rotations, she is vulnerable but that's where the W comes in. I don't think that her W should last 8 seconds, that's way to long. It has a long CD but it doesn't really matter if she plops that down and waits for her spells to come back up, re-engages and kills you. 

I talked to the Akali after the game was over and you know what her opinion on Akali was? "A no skill, free win champion." Awesome. I was at least hoping for her to deny it a little bit but nope. Completely agrees.

Just me venting but still, I think Akali is way to strong.

I couldn't really snowball harder because I had a monkey ADC, but even when I was full build at 30 minutes, the enemy had Zilean, Tryndamere, Twitch with GA and 2 more things. it's your zed vs akali game?

zed vs akali is a skill/luck match-up, every time you all-in she will use W, now Zed Q and E are AOE spells, and cover a least 50% of the shroud, and if you are lucky and those spells hit her when she is invisible you'll win the trade/all-in, and if you aren't, you'll lose. It's that simple there is no secret.

AOE into the shroud -> win

CC + full combo when she dashes behind you with R -> win

her Q+AA is rather weak, plenty champions have better combo, if your Q+AA is better -> win

if your champion can't do any of the above -> lose

here a tip btw, akali never stands in the middle of the shroud but at the edge of it, so make sure when you cast a spell it touches the shroud's circumference, and she never stands at the same exact spot she was before using the shroud but somewhere else so don't aim where she was before casting the shroud.
